ArticleTitle.sentence: Identification of transcriptional suppressor proteins that bind to the negative regulatory element of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1.

event.clue: Identification of transcriptional suppressor proteins that bind to the negative regulatory element of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1.

AbstractText.sentence: Two different proteins which independently bound to neighboring sequences within the negative regulatory element (NRE) of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) were detected in the nuclear extract of a virus-infected human T cell line.

event.clue: Two different proteins which independently bound to neighboring sequences within the negative regulatory element (NRE) of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) were detected in the nuclear extract of a virus-infected human T cell line.
event.comment: NER: T4 sem mod, Other_name -> DNA_domain_or_region; TPS: A21

event.clue: Two different proteins which independently bound to neighboring sequences within the negative regulatory element (NRE) of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) were detected in the nuclear extract of a virus-infected human T cell line.

AbstractText.sentence: One of the factors bound to a novel dyad symmetrical sequence.

event.clue: One of the factors bound to a novel dyad symmetrical sequence.

AbstractText.sentence: This sequence is well conserved in various HIV-1 isolates and partial homology was found with the promoter region of the human retinoblastoma gene.
Similar DNA binding activity was detected in a variety of virus-uninfected human T cell lines and HeLa cells by means of a gel mobility shift assay.

event.clue: Similar DNA binding activity was detected in a variety of virus-uninfected human T cell lines and HeLa cells by means of a gel mobility shift assay.
Similar DNA binding activity was detected in a variety of virus-uninfected human T cell lines and HeLa cells by means of a gel mobility shift assay.

AbstractText.sentence: The other factor bound to a putative AP-1 recognition sequence predicted for the HIV-1 NRE.

event.clue: The other factor bound to a putative AP-1 recognition sequence predicted for the HIV-1 NRE.
The other factor bound to a putative AP-1 recognition sequence predicted for the HIV-1 NRE.

AbstractText.sentence: However, this factor did not bind to a typical AP-1 site.

event.clue: However, this factor did not bind to a typical AP-1 site.

AbstractText.sentence: The insertion of multiple copies of the binding site for the former or latter factor into a heterologous promoter reduced the promoter activity to one-tenth or one-third, respectively.

event.clue: The insertion of multiple copies of the binding site for the former or latter factor into a heterologous promoter reduced the promoter activity to one-tenth or one-third, respectively.

AbstractText.sentence: Thus, each factor may function as a novel negative regulator of transcription.

event.clue: Thus, each factor may function as a novel negative regulator of transcription.
